snippet: A settlement has led to an uncomfortable and often rancorous tug of war, complicated by politics and real estate prices in one of the nation’s wealthiest suburban areas.
abstract: Westchester County is ahead of schedule in building 750 affordable residences mandated in 2009 settlement with Housing and Urban Development agency; some critics say, however, that rather than representing true economic and racial integration, many of the housing units are being built far from the heart of affluent white communities, retaining the feel of exclusionary zoning practices.
lead_paragraph: A settlement has led to an uncomfortable and often rancorous tug of war, complicated by politics and real estate prices in one of the nation’s wealthiest suburban areas.

headline.seo: Westchester County’s Commitment to Affordable Housing Agreement Is Questioned
headline.main: Despite 2009 Deal, Affordable Housing Roils Westchester
headline.print_headline: In Westchester County, Doubts About Commitment to Housing Deal
